column1: '''''Exploring J.R.R. Tolkien’s The Hobbit''''' is chapter-by-chapter companion to ''[[The Hobbit]]'' by [[Corey Olsen]].

''The Hobbit'' has been a childhood classic for decades. Millions have read and loved it before they reached high school; many carry cherished memories of a parent reading the book aloud to them. For some readers, it opens the door to a world of fantasy which will enrich the rest of their lives. The Hobbit is one of the most widely read and best-loved books of the twentieth century.

Exploring J.R.R. Tolkien’s ''The Hobbit'' is a fun, thoughtful, and insightful companion volume, designed to bring a thorough and original new reading of this great work to a general audience.  Professor Corey Olsen (also known as the Tolkien Professor) will take readers on an in-depth journey through The Hobbit chapter by chapter, revealing the stories within the story: the dark desires of dwarves and the sublime laughter of [[elves]], the nature of evil and its hopelessness, the mystery of divine providence and human choice, and, most of all, the revolutions within the life of [[Bilbo Baggins]]. Exploring J.R.R. Tolkien’s ''The Hobbit'' is a book which will make ''The Hobbit'' come alive for readers as it never has before.
